column4: hi. compiz doesn't start automatically on login. the compiz fusion icon thinks compiz is running, but it doesn't work until i select it again.
you might have a saved session that doesnt parse
how might i fix that? i have been thinking something is up with my gnome-config :)
delete all your saved sessions
where are they?
am i supposed to set Desktop Effects to normal? it's "none" now.
if you have the same issue as I did - do that rm, log out and in again and then turn on compiz
what should i delete? i don't know where the sessions are.
rm -R ~/.config/gnome-session/saved-session
thank you :)
brb
ok i did that and logged back in, but still had to start compiz manually.
yeah but maybe now it works if you log out and back in
ok i will try in a moment
and i am still getting tearing issues with nvidia despite all the sync-to-vblank boxes being checked
using vdp ?
vdpau
i see vdpau packages in synaptic, but no program.
do you mean the nvidia options menu thing?
how do I tell whether vdpau is running?
the system seems to think this monitor refreshes at 59.88 hz
my tearing occurs only during window moving, not video playback.
however i can't seem to play dvd's. movie player says "error reading from resource" instead. i have ubuntu-restriced-extras installed though
